texts.es: Don Eufemio de 50 años su esposa es ama de casa tienen 3 hijos, el es una persona trabajadora a sus hijos les está dando estudios  para que se preparen para enfrentar la vida, don Eufemio tiene un negocio de Cyber café que lo administra su hijo mayor de 23 años, también vende gas licuado, siempre se desempeña como albañil y es pastor de una iglesia evangélica es una persona muy activa, sus créditos los ha utilizado en mejora de su casa, este nuevo préstamo número 13 lo necesita para continuar la construcción del muro trasero de su casa, para eso requiere comprar piedra cantera, bloques, estribos, cemento, alambre de amarre, hierro y el pago de mano de obra para poder continuar con su pequeño proyecto de desarrollo con la familia.
texts.en:
Eufemio is 50 years old and his wife is a housewife. They have three children. He’s a hard worker who is providing his children with education so that they can face life. Eufemio has a cyber café business managed by his eldest son of 23 years. He also sells propane, works as a builder and is the pastor of an Evangelical church. 
He has used the loans to make house improvements. This is his 13th loan and will be used to continue building the back wall of his house. He needs to buy quarry stones, cement blocks, struts, cement, support straps, iron and payment for manual labor to continue the small development project with his family.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, cement blocks, struts, cement, support straps, iron and payment for manual labor to build the back wall.

loans.name: Gricelda De La Cruz

texts.es: Doña Griselda de 39 años de edad, su esposo siempre trabaja en un taller de torno y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, sus tres hijos el mayor de 16 años su gran deseo es que ellos prosperen en la vida a través de los estudios y que sean profesionales, ella trabaja de conserje en una empresa avícola, su crédito anterior fue para construir un muro frontal, pero no logro hacerlo debido a que construyo de concreto toda la parte de la sala de su  casa, ahora utilizara el crédito en la instalación de aguas negras y la construcción de baño e inodoro, comprara tubos pvc, inodoro, arena, bloques, cemento, el pago de la mano de obra y así poco a poco irá haciéndole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en: Griselda is 39 years old. Her husband works in a lathe workshop and helps with home expenses and their three children, the oldest of whom is 16. Her great wish is for them to prosper in life through their studies and be professionals. She works as a janitor in a poultry business. Her last loan was for building a front wall, but she was not able to build the wall since she built the entire living room of her house out of concrete. Now she will use this loan for sewage installation and the construction of a bathtub and toilet. She will buy PVC pipes, a toilet, sand, blocks and cement, and will also pay for labor, and this way she will continue making improvements to her home little by little.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipes, a toilet, sand, blocks and cement, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Carla Lucero

texts.es:
Carla es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asi como también por así como también su agricultura y sobre todo la generosidad de sus pobladores. Carla es una joven muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas desde hace 2 años, ya que sus padres son de condición humilde y debido a algunos problemas el dinero no les alcanzaba para poder solventar los gastos del hogar, por ello con mucho ahorro y esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio; ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y ella cree que le va bien porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Carla esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores y una refrigeradora, con lo cual podrá exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y también conservar sus productos en buenas condiciones, así ella mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Carla is a young, nineteen-year-old woman who lives alongside her parents in the city of Imperial.  The city is characterized as having a warm and welcoming climate, as well as being known for its farming and, above all, for the generosity of its people.  Carla is hard-working and makes a living in her small business where she has been selling snack items for the past two years.  

Her parents live in humble conditions and due to some money problems, they were not making enough to be able to cover the home expenses. With savings and a lot of effort, she succeeded in starting her business.  She works about ten hours a day and believes that her business is going well because she is very kind to her customers and has a lot of desire to continue moving forward.

Carla is very thankful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the great support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy display counters and a refrigerator.  With these items she will be able to display her products in a better way and also keep her products in good condition, thereby increasing her income.  She will continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream come true: "to study a career at the university and to be able to support her family."

loans.use: to buy display counters and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, 56, is married with 10 children. Seven of them are single and three are married.  Sang runs a pig farm in the backyard of her house and also has a rice farming business. She has been in this type of business for over five years. She breeds and raises hogs to sell to local traders or butchers in her community upon their optimum growth while her husband is involved in trading firewood to support their living. Through their determination and sacrifices, they hope for a higher income and to enable their children to finish their studies at high school level minimum.

For great changes in their current businesses, Sang would like to acquire a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a plowing machine for farming. This tool can also be used for transportation purposes whenever they attach it with a trailer. Sang’s husband will be able to load his firewood and distribute it to marketplaces quickly. She hopes that the loan will be granted to her to develop their businesses as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine for farming.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 49 years and a responsible mother of two school-aged children. She and her spouse raise their children in small community of Kampong Chhnang province. Kim has a business position and manages a stall in a local market where she sells a variety of fish. She has been in this occupation for almost 10 years, earning approximately 13,000 KHR per day. Kim’s husband finances the family with income generated from trading poultry and animals.

To help Kim’s husband with transportation support in his trading activities, Kim is asking for a loan in the sum of 4,000,000 KHR to purchase a motorcycle. This purchase will enable her husband in transporting his products to the marketplaces. She hopes that someday her family-owned businesses will grow and become a viable source of income as they continuously strive to improve.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the support of her livestock trading business.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin is a 41-year-old farmer living with his family in Kompong Speu province. Rice farming is the primary business and source of income for his family. He grows rice on a few hectares of farmland and he is able to make a decent income to supply the household. However, the income is barely enough to cover his daily costs, so he also works as a paid laborer for additional income. Most of the villagers appreciate his hard work. Yin’s wife opened a tailoring shop in their community to help him in generating a livelihood and uplifting a better standard of living.

Recently, Yin has hired a few laborers to perform the construction in renovating his present house but he has insufficient capital. Therefore, he is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase supplies needed for the construction. Yin has nevertaken a loan with HKL before and it will be his first loan. He promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is 31 years old and was born in Kompong Speu province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse and has been blessed with one child. She also has a younger sister who lives with her under the same roof. She manages her own farmland on which she usually grows rice in each rainy season to make a livelihood while her husband distributes and trades firewood from his trailer. This direct selling business depends on proper transportation and trailer loads of firewood. 

Chum needs a loan to be able to purchase a bigger trailer for transporting a large amount of firewood to the marketplaces. The previous trailer is old and barely suitable to use--that’s why Chum needs to buy a trailer to sustain the business. She hopes the purchase will enable them to make a better income as well as to grow their firewood business.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger trailer for transporting a large amount of firewood to the marketplaces.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is originally from Kompong Speu province. He lives there with his spouse and some of his children. Presently, six of his children are already married while the remaining child is single and helps them with the farming business.  Chea and his wife help each other manage their own farmland for their livelihood. Together, they are able to generate income in the neighborhood of USD 4.00 per day and they have been in the business for more over 30 years. Despite their hardships, Chea would like to help their descendants to get a higher education. 

The purpose of the loan he requested from HKL and Kiva is to pay for tuition fees for his grandchild who is attending a university. He believes that he will be able to help him finish his education so that he can have a bright future someday.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for his grandchild who is attending a university.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang, aged 30, is the head of his family that is comprised of four members. He is married to a garment worker and is blessed with two children. He untiringly works at the rice field to provide daily sustenance to his family. Kang has been in this occupation for more than seven years, earning an average income of 7,000 KHR per day. 

At this time, Kang would like to renovate his house partially in order to keep his family in good conditions. Due the lack of capital, he is now asking for a loan in the sum of 1,500 USD to pay for construction costs and to purchase construction materials such as window frames, planks of wood and nails. In the future, Kang hopes to make improvements in farming business and help his children in their education. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs and to purchase construction materials such as window frames, planks of wood and nails.

In the future, Khawla is planning to expand her project and increase her income in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop and she wants to increase her family income.

loans.name: Kagera Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early 40s, is married and lives together with her husband and two children (a boy and a girl) one who attends school while the other one has completed schooling.  Mary has been running her local restaurant (mama lishe) for four years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Mary used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock by purchasing more sacks to sell, covering her household expenses, and she has successfully repaid all her loans.

Mary hopes for a loan to replace old items like plates and chairs in her mama lishe business in order to make the business attractive as well as to attract more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group " Kagera" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replace old items like plates and chairs in her mama lishe (local restaurant)

loans.name: Elmer Americo

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por que se desarrolla la agricultura en especial se cultiva algodón, uva, entre otros. Elmer es un joven muy trabajador, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, Elmer trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder brindarle algo mejor a su familia. 

Elmer esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los tramites para obtener su licencia de conducir ya que sufrió un robo y perdió todo sus documentos, de esta manera el podrá conducir con todos los permisos en regla y seguir luchando para poder conseguir hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Elmer is twenty-three years old and lives in the district of Santiago, an area that is characterized by farming and development, and in particular, the cultivation of cotton and grapes, among others.  Elmer is a hard-working man so that he can support his parents and their home expenses with the fruit of his labor.  

Elmer works as a moto-taxi driver.  He works about ten hours a day and can serve twenty customers daily.  He believes that his work is going well because he is kind to his customers and above all, he has a lot of drive to continue moving forward and to offer something better to his family.

Elmer is very thankful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the help that has been offered to him, he will be able to cover the expenses to get his driver's license, since he was robbed and lost all of his documents.  He will be able to legally drive and continue fighting to be able to realize his biggest dream: "to finish building his house of higher-quality material."

loans.use: to cover expenses for replacing his stolen driver's license.

loans.name: Pedro Andres

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 57 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Pedro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer un riquísimo Ceviche con sus amigos. 
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años Pedro trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño ya que se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que él desea poder realizar los acabos de los servicios higiénicos, tanto en la puesta de servicios, pintado y puesta de piso; de esta manera Pedro tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, adecuadas, seguras y salubres, que brinden mayor bienestar para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 57-year-old single man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, Pedro was not able to study for a professional career as, from a very young age, he had to work to help his parents with the household expenses.  In his free time he likes playing football with his friends and neighbours, and occasionally takes the opportunity to eat a delicious ceviche [a seafood dish] with his friends.

For a number of years Pedro has worked as a labourer on a farm in his city.  Every day, in the very early hours of the morning, he begins his work and can work for about 12 hours.  He believes that his business is going well due to his hard work, as he enjoys his job. 

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders, as with the help he receives he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to be able to finish off his bathroom by installing a toilet, painting and laying flooring.  This will mean that Pedro's home will be in a better, adequate, safe and healthy condition, which will improve his own and his family's well-being.

loans.use: To carry out improvements to his home.

loans.name: Diunieski Liseth

texts.es: La joven Diunieski de 25 años de edad es soltera sin hijos, habita en casa de su mamá, desde hace 3 años labora en el área de informática en una institución del gobierno. Esta solicitando su 1er crédito con el objetivo de comprar materiales como arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, alambre y el pago de la mano de obra lo que utilizara para embaldosar y repellar la casa, así acondicionar la vivienda para que luzca bonita y sus paredes sean más duraderas, de esa manera ella apoya a su madre.
texts.en:
Diunieki is a 25-year-old young woman. She is single, does not have children and lives at her mother's house. She has been working in computer science at a government institution for the past 3 years. 

She is requesting her first loan in order to buy materials such as sand, cement, cinder blocks, iron, wire, and to pay for labor, in order to tile and plaster the house. Thus, she will improve the house so it looks pretty and so that its walls last longer. In this way she will help her mother.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, sand, iron, wire, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Brenda Lucia

texts.es: La joven Brenda, es soltera sin hijos labora como docente de secundaria desde hace 10 años para una escuela, es una mujer que ama su profesión de docencia impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de la comunidad, es una persona que ha lidiado por un porvenir mejor. Solicita su quinto crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción para poder realizar un anexo a su vivienda. Su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de mejores condiciones en su hogar, tener estabilidad laboral para seguir haciendo mejoras y poder pagar sus cuotas y que su familia goce de salud, con el préstamo comprara cemento, bloques, arena, hierro, alambre y pagara la mano de obra.
texts.en: Young Brenda is single and doesn't have children. She has been working as a middle school teacher for the past ten years. She's a woman who loves teaching and sharing the gift of knowledge with local peasant children. She's someone who has struggled towards a better future. She requests her fifth loan in order to invest in the purchase of construction supplies so that she can build an addition to her house. Her biggest dream in life is improving her living conditions; having work stability in order to keep on making progress; being able to repay the loan; and seeing her family enjoy good health. With the loan she'll purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron and wire, and she'll pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron and wire, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Don Fidel tiene tres hijos mayores de edad a quienes dio crecer con su trabajo como contador para una empresa privada pero con el tiempo se dedico a taxear y ahora lleva 20 años desempeñándose en esa labor, su esposa ama de casa. Don Fidel con este crédito solicitado desea poner el cielo raso de su casa y poco a poco la ira reparando para darles como herencia a sus nietos para que lo recuerden siempre, con el crédito comprara láminas de plycem y materiales para el marco. 
Su plan a futuro es poner un comedor como negocio y no andar en las calles manejando de lo cual ya está cansado de este oficio ya que es bien desgastante y a veces hasta peligroso.
texts.en:
Fidel has three adult children. He was able to raise them with the support of his job as an accountant for a private business. However, over time, he began to work as a taxi driver and now has twenty years of experience with this work. His wife takes care of the home. Fidel is requesting this loan because he wants to put up a false ceiling in his home. Little by little, he works on repairing his home so his grandchildren can inherit it and remember him by it. With this loan, he will buy sheets of Plycem, a type of cement fiberboard, and materials for a doorframe.

His plan for the future is to open an eatery as a business instead of driving a taxi on the streets. He is tired of this work because it wears him out and, sometimes, it is dangerous.

loans.use: to buy sheets of Plycem and materials for a doorframe.

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Ala prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her father.

Ala. a 20-year-old married mother of one from Al Zarqa in Jordan, has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing in blankets. In the future, Ala is planning to open her own clothes shop and buy a house for her family.

Since Ala is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in blankets.

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en: Ebtesam is a 46-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has seven children and requested a 300 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. in the future, Ebtesam is planning to do further amendments.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old engaged male from Jarash in Jordan. He has five dependents and requested a 1500 JOD loan to pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is a 25-year-old married man who has 2 family members from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for home improvements. He would like to repaint his home and buy new furniture. He hopes to provide a good environment for his family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fatemah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Fatemah is a 51-year-old married female from Bani Kenanah in Jordan. She has six children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing grocery items, nuts, and cleaning supplies. In the future, Fatemah is planning to expand her project and buy some shelves for the goods and do some painting for the place she is working from. As a second step, Fatemah wants to widen the variety of goods in order to increase income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for retailing grocery items, nuts, and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nahla prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Nahla is a 42-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buy some furniture. In the future, Nahla is planning to do some extensions to her house.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Tghreed

texts.en: Tghreed is a 25-year-old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She has 2 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home's improvement expenses and to buy some houseware tools. Tghreed needs to buy a freezer. In the future, she is planning to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses

loans.name: Soad

texts.en: Soad is a 43-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan who has 12 family members. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the kitchen and bathroom and to do decorating to improve her living standard. She hopes in the future to expand her home and she is planning on adding another room in her home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en: Ekhlas is a 40-year-old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for buying the tools and materials needed to work in ceramics. In the future, Ekhlas is planning to expand her project to include several hand-made productions in order to increase income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for working in ceramics

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Kafa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Kafa is a 53-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home's improvement expenses and to buy some furniture, like a closet and a fridge. In the future, Kafa is planning to build an additional room.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvement expenses

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Wejdan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Wejdan is a 40-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for her clothing and sewing business. Wejdan is planning to buy a sewing machine. In the future, she wants to buy more machines and open her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for her clothing and sewing business

loans.name: Sherihan

texts.en:
Sherihan is a 27-year-old single female from Marka in Jordan. She requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes and blankets, and selling them to the neighbours. In the future, Sherihan is planning to buy a car and a house.

Since Sherihan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is a 24-year-old married woman who has two family members; she comes from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements;she would like to buy new furniture and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to buy more furniture and some household items to improve her family living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sobeyda Claribel

texts.es: Sobeyda habitante de la zona 2 de  Nueva Guinea es casada, madre de un niño, trabaja como docente para una escuela, solicita su primer crédito para realizar mejora de su vivienda, así construir un dormitorio en su casa por lo que necesita comprar arena bloques, cemento, hierro, piedrín y pagar la mano de obra, su mayor objetivo es tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda. Sobeyda ha demostrado capacidad y voluntad de pago, esta agradecida con Afodenic y Kiva, su mayor sueño es tener su casa bonita y agradable, lo cual la hará sentirse mejor.
texts.en:
Sobeyda, a resident of zone 2 of Nueva Guinea, is married, and the mother of a child. She also works as a teacher for a school. 

She is requesting her first loan in order to make improvements on her home. Therefore, to build a bedroom in her house she needs to buy sand, cement, cinder blocks, iron, and gravel, and pay for labor. Her main goal is to have better conditions in her home. Sobeyda has demonstrated ability and willingness to repay. She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva. 

Her biggest dream is to have a beautiful and pleasant home, which will make her feel better.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, cinder blocks, iron, and gravel, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add a room to his house.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: El Señor  Raúl tiene la edad de 28 años esta casado con la Señora Rocío tienen 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando en primaria en esta ocasión esta solicitando el segundo crédito porque invertir en la tienda de abarrotes ya que le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía. Es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito para surtir su negocio  y así puedan cubrir todas la necesidades que sus clientes.  Su esposa y El se encargan de atender el negocio en diferentes horarios ya que el cuenta con un empleo extra esta muy agradecido con el apoyo  que a tenido. Con las ganancias obtenidas de las ventas del negocio será para pagar el crédito ya que con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Raul is 28 years old, he is married with Rocio and they have 2 children who attend primary school.
He is currently asking for his second loan because he needs to invest it in his grocery store because he is very low on merchandise.  With this loan he will supply the store, and therefore be able to cover all the needs of his clients.  He and his wife run the shop at different times of day because he has a second job. Raul is deeply grateful for the support he has received.  With the sales from his store he will be able to pay back the loan, and with his salary from his other job he pays for household expenses and his children's school.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía para el negocio de abarrotes

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
El Señor Natividad tiene la edad de 44 años es chofer de taxis desde hace 12 años también cuenta con una concesión
En esta ocasión esta solicitando en nuestra institución el quinto crédito para actualizar y pagar dicha concesión ya es un ingreso mas que con el cuenta esta casado con la Sra. rosa ella trabaja por su cuenta en la venta de ropa, no mantienen a ninguna persona ya que sus hijos ya están casados cuentan con su propia casa pero viven en la casa de sus papas ya que son de la tercera edad y su mama esta perdiendo la vista desea contar con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Natividad is 44 years old, he has been a taxi driver for 12 years, and he has his own taxi license.
He is currently asking for his fifth loan to our institution: he will use it to renew and pay for said license. This is an extra earning for him on top of his wife’s activity: Rosa, his wife, works on her own selling clothes. No one is economically dependent on them, as their children are already married and have houses of their own. However, Natividad and his wife live in his elderly parents’ house, as his mother is losing her eyesight. He wishes to continue counting on Kiva’s support.

loans.use: To pay for the renewal of his taxi license.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis juin 2009.IL est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même zone,elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Celle qui est en arriére plan sur la photo et levant le bras gauche est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 47 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité consiste à acheter du bois pour le revendre,elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité car l'ayant exercé pendant longtemps.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter du bois pour les revendre.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in June 2009. It consists of members who are all from the same zone, and they are in business as shopkeepers.

The one who is in the back on the photo and raising her left arm is the featured borrower. She is 47 years old, she is married and mother to 4 children.

Her business consists in buying wood to resell. She has good experience for this type of business because she has practiced it for a long time.

With this loan she plans to buy wood to resell it.

Her goal is to provide for her children's schooling and health.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Yohima Del Rosario

texts.es: Yohima del Rosario de 26 años de edad, es habitante de la zona 5 de Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera, comerciante, posee su propio negocio donde ha salido adelante ella sola, este es su tercer crédito el cual necesita para realizar mejora de su vivienda en esta ocasión su dormitorio, por lo que requiere comprar cemento, arena, bloque, piedrín, hierro, alambre y pagar mano de obra y asi darles mejores condiciones a su dos niños menores de edad y mejor calidad de vida, esta agradecida con Afodenic y Kiva, ya que ha salido adelante y mejorado la econimia de su familia.
texts.en:
Yohima del Rosario is a 26-year-old single mother who lives in zone 5 of Nueva Guinea.  She is a merchant and has her own business where she has gotten ahead all on her own.  

This is her third loan, which she needs in order to make some home improvements. In this case, she will be making improvements to her bedroom.  She will need to buy cement, sand, concrete block, gravel, iron, and wiring as well as pay for labor.  These improvements will provide better living conditions and a better quality of life for her two school-aged children.  

She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva because she has prospered and increased her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, concrete block, gravel, iron, and wiring as well as pay labor costs to make improvements to her room.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofía de 62 años de edad es casada, sus hijos ya mayores de edad que apoyan con los gastos de la casa, ella es pequeña agricultora de la zona donde vive, solicita nuevamente un segundo financiamiento ante Afodenic, con el objetivo de sembrar 4 Mzs de maíz, por lo que necesita comprar insumos y fertilizantes para lograr su objetivo. Cabe señalar que Sofía es una persona con mucha experiencia en dicho rubro y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda con las labores del campo.
texts.en:
Sofia is 62 and married. Her children are adults now and they help with the household expenses. 

She is a small farmer in the area where she lives and is requesting a second loan from Afodenic in order to plant 4 manzanas [6.8 acres] of corn, for which she needs to buy supplies and fertilizers to achieve this goal. It is important to note that Sofia has plenty of experience in the field and has the support of her husband who helps her out in the fields.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to plant corn.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Don Marvin de 40 años de edad es soltero, es pequeño productor de la zona donde vive, Solicita su 2do crédito para invertirlo en la compra de 4 terneros de 200 kls los cuales cuidaría y esperaría que tuvieran un buen tamaño y peso para venderlos a un precio que obtenga buenas ganancias. Su mayor sueño es poder ver consolidado su hato ganadero para poder dejar a sus hijos un buen patrimonio con el que puedan trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marvin is 40 years old and is single. He is a small farmer in the area where he lives. He is requesting his second loan, which he will use to buy four calves of 200 kgs each. He will rear these calves until they are a good size and weight, then he will sell them at a price that will earn him a good profit.

His biggest dream is to see his herd grow strong so that he can leave his children a good inheritance that they can work in order to have a good life.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Don Felipe de 43 años de edad es casado, su familia se compone por su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el mayor de 12 años, otro de 8 y el menor de 4 añitos todos estudian, su esposa está pendiente del cuido de ellos, con los quehaceres del hogar y apoya a su esposo en algunas labores del campo. Felipe es pequeño productor de la zona donde vive, Solicita su 2do crédito para compra de 1 vaca parida con la cual tendría ingresos adicionales por la producción de leche lo cual su mayor deseo y objetivo es poder aumentar su hato ganadero para poder dejarle a sus hijos el trabajo seguro con el que puedan trabajar para salir adelante y tener el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Felipe, 43 years old, is married. His family includes his wife and their three children; the oldest is 12 years old, another is 8 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old. They are all in school. His wife is in charge of caring for them, completing the household chores, and helping Felipe with some of the outdoor work. Felipe is a small farmer on his area of land. 

He is requesting his second loan to buy a calf, with which he will have additional income from milk production. His greatest desire and goal is to increase his cattle herd so he can leave them with his children. This way, they will have secure jobs to work at so they can move forward and have the necessities in life.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Rosalia Matilde

texts.es: La señora Rosalia de 43 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo que está estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja como mecánico automotriz en su taller ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella trabaja como técnico para una empresa privada desde hace 24 años. Solicita este cuarto crédito para invertirlos en mejoras de su vivienda, esta vez para el cambio de techo en el área de la sala, cocina y reparación del porche los cuales se encuentran en mal estado, por lo que necesita comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, cemento, bloques, arena y hierro. Cabe mencionar que es una señora muy responsable y que a través de los préstamos ha ido mejorando poco a poco su hogar para llegar a tener un lugar seguro y bonito donde vivir con su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Rosalia, 43, is married and has one son.  Her son is in high school and her husband operates an auto repair business from a workshop behind their house.  Rosalia has worked as a technician for a private company for 24 years.  She is applying for a loan, her fourth, that she will use to make improvements to her house.  The investment will allow her to buy the building materials--roofing, perlines, cement, concrete blocks, sand, iron bar--she needs for the project.  Rosalia is a responsible woman and she has made significant improvements to her house with past loans.  Her goal is to improve the house, bit by bit, and make it a safer, more attractive place for her family to live.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house improvement project.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket is 53 years old and a determined mother of four children: two married children and two single children. Ket devotes her full attention to a rice farming business to provide enough sustenance for her family. Since she was a widowed woman, she has tried harder in her current business to help the two younger children in their education. Despite the hardships, Ket aims to have them finished their high school level. Ket is happy that her married children usually send a small remittance home each month to support the family financially each month.

With this loan amount, Ket would like to purchase a motorcycle which will be used to support as transportation for both household use and business. This loan will help some of her children in travelling to their workplaces and reduce the expenses on transportation costs. Someday, Ket would like to keep growing her farming business during her entrepreneurship and help her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle which will be used to support as transportation for both household use and business.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 37 years old, is married with three school-aged children. Phuong is in the construction business in mobile places as the family’s main source of income. Phuong untiringly earns income because he is determined to uplift his family out of poverty and educate all of his children. Phuong is proud of his wife who is very supportive in raising the family. She has a position in a local garment factory of Kompong Speu province. 

Phuong has encountered difficulties due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting, especially to his workplaces. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for traveling to construction sites. Also, Phuong plans to use it as a transportation business in his community during his unemployed periods. This will help better his income and develop his business gradually. In the future, Phuong would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for traveling to construction sites.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is a 60-year-old married woman who has been living in Kompong Speu province of Cambodia. She is a mother of nine children, currently five of whom are married and some of the rest children are employed to support the family financially. Say and her spouse has been a farmer for long time ago. They cultivate and harvest rice in each season for their daily food.

Say is requesting a loan through HKL because she wants to make improvements in her business. She will purchase a cow for farming purpose. With the help of the loan, Say is convinced that she will be able to reduce operating cost partially and make her business more viable. In the future, Say is going to save a portion of her profit for the expansion of her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for farming purpose.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In is a widowed woman who has no children for her life but she is a proud farmer who manages one hectare and a half of farmland where she usually grows rice each rainy season. In, at 46, has worked very hard in order to maintain a good business as well as her living status. In is a resident of Kompong Speu province, Cambodia.

At the moment, In is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD through HKL and Kiva lenders. With this loan, she will be able to prepare a religious ceremony for her parents who passed away. For most Cambodian people, this celebration is meaningful and is to show gratefulness to their dead parents and ancestors who did good deeds over their lives. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her for the above-mentioned purpose.

loans.use: to prepare a religious ceremony for her parents who passed away.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing is 58 years old and a retired policeman who always helps his wife manage their farm and take care of the family that is comprised of six children. Five of them are already married and have independent lives. Hing is thankful to his wife who has helped him in every situation to better their family economically since the beginning. That is why he is very supportive and a hardworking father for the household.

Now Hing is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to invest in their farming business effectively. Through using the loan, he will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the operating costs in farming. Hopefully, he will have a fruitful harvest in the coming season. In the future, he wishes to own extra lots of farmland and increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for operating costs in farming.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat is 51 years old and a mother of four children. She is a low-income woman who pays her full devotion to her farming business in Kompong Speu province. She has worked in this field with the help of her spouse and children. Financial constraints on the family prevented all her children from attending school. And recently, all of them are employed by a local garment factory to boost the household income and satisfy their living needs.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her children for commuting to their workplaces. Khat mentioned that this will help them to cut down their daily expenses on transportation costs so that they can save more money for other purposes. She is glad and grateful for the constant help from Kiva lenders. She promises to pay her loan back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children's commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem, aged 53, is a resident living with his family in Kompong Speu province. He pursues rice farming as his focused business, from which he is able to generate a decent income to raise his family. His wife has a position in a local market to add to his income. Together, they are responsible for six children. Four of them are married and the rest two are ready for high school. Chhoem realizes that he will need more funds to support his children’s education at their high school level, so he would like to be involved in animal trading business to supplement his income.

Due to insufficient capital, Chhoem is taking out a loan in the amount of 600 USD to purchase animals for sale.  He hopes that he would have better revenue through the investment in animal-sale business and he will be able to further support his children’s education so that they might have a bright future. He is very thankful for the help of the loan and promises to use it wisely.

loans.use: to purchase animals for sale.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak is 53 years old, married and a rural villager from Kompong Speu province. She has four children – a married son and three single children who still depend on her income and help her in farming business. Chaks owns and manages one hectare and half of paddy field to make a livelihood while her husband operates a medium oven for making charcoal and supplies in his neighborhood. 

Chak has been with HKL for one loan and has already successfully repaid the previous loan. She used the loan to sustain her farming business. In the same manner, Chak is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production. She hopes for better yields and profit so that she will be able to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung is a 50-year-old married woman who has five children. Ung works hard at the rice field every day to generate income, which she usually uses to cover her daily costs, especially food. She has been in this business for over 30 years and it has become the primary source of income for the family. In the past few years, all of her children quit studying due to the family’s financial difficulties and they have been employed in various jobs to help the entire family ever since. Two of them work as garment workers while some of the rest help their parents in cultivating rice and raising poultry.

Ung is concerned about her children’s safety because they don’t have their own vehicle for commuting to their workplaces. They usually use motorcycle transportation service and thus have to spend money on transportation costs daily. In order to help them to own a motorcycle, Ung would like to request a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase one for their commute. She hopes that Kiva lenders won't reject her loan and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children's commute to work.

loans.name: Heow

texts.en:
Heow is 38 years old, single and lives with his brother and sister in Kompong Speu province. He has been operating a small farm to generate income for his family, while his younger brother owns a small barbershop in their village and serves local people with his hair removal service. To financially help the family, his youngest sister is also employed in a local garment factory. Together, they always help each other with their generated income.

In the past two years, Heow attended a vocational training school at Phnom Penh city in the field of generator mechanics. In regard to this, he is taking out this loan to pay back the cost of his course of study and a certificate. He realizes that he will be able to provide this type of service in his neighborhood if he could find a good location and have enough capital to establish his own business. He hopes that his dream will come true someday and he will save a portion of his profit toward achieving his dream.

loans.use: to pay back the cost of his course of study and a certificate.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak is a humble villager from Kompong Speu province’s Chbar Mon district. She is 47 years old and a widow with five children. Her oldest child is married already while the remaining are single and help her both in farming and a retail business. Aside from farming activities, Chak operates a retail store in a local market, selling kitchen supplies such as plates, bowls, spoons, forks, frying pan and pots. She has been engaged in her business for almost 20 years and earns approximately 24,000 KHR per day.

Chak would like to expand her business and have more customers using her products. That’s why she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to invest in her retail business. She will use a portion of the loan to purchase a trailer for loading a large quantity of her merchandise.  From the trailer, those of her children will be able to sell more products from place to place and this will increase their profit. Also, she will buy stock of her inventory with the remaining funds. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions as she and her children strive to work hard.

loans.use: to invest in her retail business and to purchase a trailer for loading a large quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros is 37 years old and a resident from Dongkor district, Phnom Penh. He is married with two children. Ros and his wife help each other in raising and educating their children. He earns his income from a mechanical repair business, while his wife has a business position in the market selling fast food. He operates his business far away from his home, in a public gathering where there are more travelers passing his repair shop. He has been in this field for more than six years and typically makes around 5 USD per day.

Ros decided to look for a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. Currently, Ros often gets a taxi service and pays for the costs every day. He hopes that this vehicle will enable him to save more profits for his family and help him in his transportation needs. He would be grateful if he could have financial support from lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Sokhen is 58 years old and a local farmer originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has managed her five hectares of farmland with her husband to grow rice. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. 

Sokhen has been with VisionFund for the past three cycles. She has used her past loans with success in upgrading her living conditions to being better than before, and has fully paid back the loans already. Now, she is the leader of the group consisting of three female members. The total amount of this group is 1,600,000 KHR. For Sokhen's portion, in the amount of 500,000 KHR, she will use it to purchase fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farm. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her rice on time and provide her with a good yield. Hence, she can generate more income better than before in order to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farm

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is 64 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom (a daughter) still depends on her and is currently helping with the household chores. Thorn's residential area is in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where rice farming is the common business in her neighborhood as well as for Thorn. She and her husband do rice cropping on three hectares of farmland, which she has been engaged in for ten years and is able to earn almost 15,000 KHR. 

Thorn's past loan was her original loan. The prior loan, which she has paid back with success, has provided sufficient working capital to support her business and improve her lifestyle. Now, she has formed a group of four female members. She is in the second cycle loan and her remaining three members are in the first cycle loan. All of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Thorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to obtain more crop yields with a good profit so she can keep her good standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her mid-twenties, is a widow with two children. One of her children goes to school. She has been a food vendor for six years now. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees and buy missing items in the food store. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more stock of food in order to sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to own a beauty salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Msasani, which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food to sell to more people.

loans.name: Safa'a

texts.en: Safa'a is a 32-year-old married woman who has one family member and lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to help her pay for home improvements. Safa'a would like to buy new furniture for her living room. In addition, she hopes that in the future, she would be able to benefit from another loan and buy bedroom furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Maison

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Maison prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. 

Maison is a 40-year-old married woman who has four family members from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area she wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell

loans.name: Feda'a

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Feda'a prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother. 

Feda'a is a 29-year-old married woman with one family member from Jarash Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 400 to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to repaint her home and to do other maintenance. She hopes in the future to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en: Amenah is a 44-year-old married woman who has eight family members from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements: She would like to do maintenance of the home and buy new furniture. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Khadeja prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Khadeja is a 48-year-old married woman who has seven family members from Madaba, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD (Jordan dinar) to buy dishes and communication equipment to resell. She would like to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her shop and to decorate.

loans.use: to buy dishes and communications equipment to resell

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 29-year-old married woman from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes for women and children to resell to her friends and neighbors and so that she can increase her products. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to display her products to increase her income. Since Manal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
Waed is a 23-years-old married woman who has 2 family members and is from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy materials for sewing. She plans to purchase a sewing machine, fabric, silk and beads to make a clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to expand her business in the future. 

Since Waed is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Fayedah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fayedah asked that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her son.

Fayedah is a 52-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. She has 6 children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. In the future, Fayedah is planning to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Jameelah

texts.en: Jameelah is a 59-years-old widow from Baqa'a in Jordan. She has 3 children and has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell. In the future, Jameelah is planning to participate in some exhibitions, or open her own shop, in order to expand her project and increase her sales income. Jameelah would like to buy a car and build a house.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lenaa

texts.en: Lenaa is a 38-year-old married woman from Irbid Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to buy clothes for women and children to resell and she wants to buy materials for making clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to display her products and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
Waed is a 22-year-old married woman with two family members who lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for home improvements. Waed wants to use the loan to purchase a new television and undertake general home maintenance. In the future, she would like to repaint some of the rooms as well as the kitchen area in her home. Overall, Waed wants to improve her family`s living standard. 

Due to cultural reasons Waed prefers that her photograph does not get posted online. Therefore, the photograph posted with this loan profile is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Jumana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Jumana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Jumana is a 25-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 500 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for her home-improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Jumana is planning to do further amendments to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home-improvement and painting expenses.

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Rahmeh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Rahmeh is a 36-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy a new television and oven and new electronic appliances. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to buy new furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Shafa

texts.en: Shafa is a 37-years-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has 4 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Jarash, Jordan. He is requesting a 800 JOD loan in order to allow him to pay for his home improvement expenses and buy furniture. In the future, Mohammad is also planning to undertake further home improvements.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and ingredients for pastry making and selling

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 23-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy women`s and children`s clothing and accessories. Hanan is planning to resell the clothing and accessories to her friends and neighbors who live in the same of area as her. She wants to develop this business in order to increase her income. In the future Hanan hopes to buy a car and a home. 

Due to cultural reasons, Hanan prefers that her photograph is not posted online. Therefore, the photograph associated with this profile is of her father. According to the Field Partner, since Hanan is under the age of 30, this loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories for resale

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 26-year-old engaged man. He is requesting a 1000 JOD loan to allow him to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy furniture. In the future, Mustafa is planing on building a family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 45-year-old married man who has five family members from Al Aqaba, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials for making Oriental antiques because he wants to increase the number of products he can resell. He hopes in the future to expand his project by opening a shop to increase his income. 
In the picture Marwan is the man on the right and his friend is standing next to him on the left.

loans.use: to buy materials for making Oriental antiques.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 51-year-old married woman with four children from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a 600 JOD loan in order to allow her to buy additional used clothing for resale. Wedad buys used clothing from Kuwait and then sells it. In the future, she is planning to start retailing used furniture, in order to further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Dina prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother. Dina is a 24-year-old single woman from Al Khaldieh in Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell

loans.name: Najeha

texts.en: Najeha is a 37-year-old married woman with two children from Al Salt, Jordan. She is requesting a 300 JOD loan to allow her to pay for her home improvement expenses. Najeha is planning on building additional rooms in her house, in order to further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Nabiela

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nabiela prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her son. 

Nabiela is a 50-year-old married woman form Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area where she wants to increase her products. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 25-year-old married woman from Jarash in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 600 Jordanian dinar (JOD) loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buy some furniture. In the future, Areej is planning to do further improvements.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is a 35-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian dinars to pay for home improvements. She would like to do maintenance on her home and she wants to buy windows. She hopes to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 27-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to pay for home improvements. She wants to do maintenance on her home and buy new furniture for the home to improve her family's standard of living. She hopes to benefit from another loan in the future.

For cultural reasons, Noor prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Isra'a

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Isra'a prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her brother. 

Isra'a is a 24-year-old single woman from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy women's and children's clothing to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area that she wants to increase her products. In the future, she hopes to to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income. 

Since Isra'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 32-year-old married female from Jarash. She has six dependents and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home's improvements and painting expenses before the winter begins. In the future, Mona is planning to do further amendments.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvement expenses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 28-year-old single man from Jarash, Jordan. He is requesting an 800 JOD loan in order to allow him to pay for his home improvement expenses, including buying furniture and home decorations. In the future, Mohammad is planning on making further home improvements.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses

loans.name: Felip

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe tiene la edad de 32 años es casado con dos hijos el Sr., Felipe es un Sr. muy trabajador ya que tiene dos años dedicándose a invertir en negocios de abarrotes su esposa tiene una tostaderia, entre los dos han logrado tener un patrimonio lo que les ha ayudado para obtener mejores ganancias, el Sr. Felipeun nuevo local en el que esta invirtiendo para obtener mas ganancia, además de contar con ingreso extra del que ya tiene abierto por lo tanto en esta ocasión desea el apoyo de esta institución para poder comprar mas mercancía estaría muy agradecido.
texts.en: Felipe is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a hardworking man.  He has been investing in grocery stores for two years.  His wife sells tostadas. Between the two of them they have succeeded in obtaining property, which has helped them earn more income.  Felipe has a new store where he is investing to earn more income.  In addition to counting on the extra income, the store is open now and he would like the support of this institution to be able to purchase more merchandise.  He would be very grateful.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Manuel es casado tiene la edad de 50 años y tiene ya mas de 6 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, es una persona muy trabajadora porque además de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa realiza otras actividades además de contar con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja para una empresa de la localidad, el propósito del Señor Juan Manuel. Es ampliar su negocio y abrir un local, en esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para invertir en ropa de invierno desea ofrecer a sus clientes mejor variedad y ropa de temporada y así poder obtener mas ingresos desea contar con el apoyo de esta institución.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is married and is 50 years old. For the past six years he has earned a living selling clothes from his home. He is a hardworking individual because, in addition to selling clothing, he also does other activities. He also has the support of his wife who works for a local company.

Juan Manuel's goal is to expand his business and to open a shop. On this occasion he needs a loan to invest in winter clothing. He would like to offer his clients more variety and seasonal clothes in order to obtain a higher income. He hopes to have the support of this institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Nim, 33, is a rural villager from Battambang province's Moung Russey district, Cambodia. He is the father of three children. He survives his family through rice planting as his main source of income and charcoal selling as an additional income. He has been engaged in this business for 13 years. This is his second cycle with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He has used his previous loan in a smart manner by supporting his business, leading to good progress and relieving his family's burden better than before. Now, he is applying for a new loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a mini tractor to support his rice cropping business. He hopes that this purchase will double his crop output and give him a good profit for his family's sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a mini tractor

loans.name: Noeurm's Group

texts.en: Noeurm is a local farmer from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To overcome his family's hardship, he provides a motor-taxi service for a fee and his wife sells grocery items at home. He has been involved in this business for three years. Including this cycle, he is in the second-cycle loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loan has helped him to better support his wife's business on time. Now, he has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. Both of them are applying for 500,000 KHR each. For Noeurm, his entire loan amount will be used to support his wife's business by replenishing the grocery items in order to resell. He hopes to make a good profit from his purchase for his wife’s business and keep improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy, a young mother of two little kids, is 25 years old and a local resident, from Battambang Province's Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. Her sources of income are vegetable selling (basil, cabbage, eggplant, etc.) and rice farming. She has engaged in this business for five years. As a result of the successful loan that she has completely paid back, she feels empowered. Now she believes that she can support her living standard, especially in providing decent food for her children.

Navy's group consists of three members, two women and one man. They have formed this group to seek a new loan. Navy will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en: Ith is a rural villager from Moung Russey district, Battambang province, of Cambodia. She has two small children who are her dependents. For her children's sake, she grows rice, corn, and sesame. She has engaged in this business for five years. This is the first loan cycle for Ith, as well as her co-borrower in the group of two. They are seeking different loan amounts: 1,000,000 KHR for Ith, and 800,000 KHR for her co-member. Ith is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor, for both of her cash crops. She hopes to achieve high yields and sell them for good prices. Thus, she can make more income for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en: Vann, aged 45, lives in the Battambang province's Moung Russey district. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living as a rice farmer on a two-hectare piece of land. She earns about 24,000 KHR a day. She leads a two-person loan group whose members have each taken out and repaid three loans from VisionFund. These loans have helped her run her business and earn a decent income to help support her family. She is applying for a loan for 800,000 KHR and her co-borrower is seeking one for 500,000 KHR. Vann will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay people to work on her farm. She hopes to increase the size of her crop so that she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for a farm.

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn, a farmer, is originally from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is one of the breadwinners in her family, which consists of four children. Soeurn makes a daily living by farming two hectare of rice fields, from which she is able to earn about 18,900 KHR per day. Soeurn's group comprises of three members, all of which are are first-time borrowers. Each of the members is seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader of the group, Soeurn is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to increase her income and improves her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
A villager residing in a rural area of Ratanak Mondul district located in Battambang province of Cambodia, Samon is 41 years of age and married with four children, one daughter of whom is a school-aged child and still dependent on her. To make a living, Samon has a business planting corns and chilies. Having been in this business for almost 20 years, she is able to earn approximately 33,000KHR per day and save around 13,000KHR after deducting her daily cost of living.

Samon's group consists of three female members, all first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Samon is leading her group to request a loan in the amount of 1,900,000KHR in total. This hard-working woman, Samon, will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer, corn seeds and chili seeds, and pesticide to apply to her farmland. She highly hopes that, after receiving the loan, her business will achieve good quality crop yields so that she can boost her income as well as improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, corn seeds, chili seeds, and pesticide.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok, a citizen from Moung Russey district of Cambodia, is in a female-headed family consisting of six children. Her main source of income comes from rice cultivation, while growing sesame is an extra income. Engaging in this business for 23 years, she is able to earn about 12,200 KHR per day. In the group of two, Sok is the leader. She and her fellow group member are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. For Sok, her loan portion will be used to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her field. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Kheoun's Group

texts.en: Kheoun, who is 44 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are students and still dependent on her. To support her family, she farms rice on a one-hectare plot of land and plants cassava on another one-hectare plot. Each day, she earns approximately 18,000 KHR and manages to save around 10,000 KHR after offsetting her daily expenses. She has taken out and repaid a previous loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She is now requesting a second loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to help keep her farmland in good shape. Kheoun leads a five-person loan group whose members want to take out a loan for 3,600,000 KHR. Kheoun will use her portion of this loan, which is for 1,000,000 KHR, to increase her crop yields. She plans to use the additional profit she earns to buy more farmland and begin growing rubber trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Savy is 26 years old and the mother of one child who is studying at a local public school. She and her family live in the Dambae district of Cambodia, where she earns a living by growing rice and cassava on her farm. To better feed her family, she and her husband also grow rubber-tree seedlings. Savy has taken out and repaid one previous loan from VisionFund, and used it successfully to improve her family's living conditions and pay to have weeding done on her farm. She leads a two-person loan group and is seeking a loan for 1,200,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for a loan for 500,000 KHR. Savy will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and her rubber-tree seedlings. Her goal is to grow good seedlings so that she can sell them for a high price and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a farm and for rubber-tree seedlings.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom is a citizen residing in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district, located in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is a 45-year-old, married woman who has five children, three of whom are still dependent on her. To provide a decent life for her family, Sokhom farms rice, plants cassava, and raises pigs. She is applying for a 3,000,000 KHR loan. For Sokhom, this is her first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She will use a part of this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor, in order to keep her farmland in good shape. In the hope of fattening her pigs, she will spend the other portion of the loan buying pig feeds. This industrious woman, Sokhom, hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: To keep her farmland productive by buying fertilizer and pesticide, and paying for labor, and to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren is a rural citizen from Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. He is single and a farmer who grows cassava on his two hectares of farmland in order to make a living. He has engaged in this business for several years. 

Saren is the leader of a group of two seeking a loan. Both of them are first-time borrowers, and each is seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Saren will use his portion to pay for weeding fee. Moreover, he is going to use a portion of it to buy insecticide for his cassava field. He hopes to make more income from his current business so he can improve his living condition.

loans.use: To pay for weeding and buy insecticide for his cassava field

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en:
Saveth is 36 years old and resides in Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two dependent kids (one daughter and one son).
