She wants to have more stock of groceries such as canned goods,assorted biscuits,soft drinks and some detergent soap to sell within her local community. With her determination to improve her variety store,she is seeking for additional working capital in the amount of PHP 20,000. She hopes to make her business more productive so that her expectations and dreams will be fulfilled someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries such as canned goods,assorted biscuits,soft drinks and some detergent soap for her retail store

loans.name: Carlyn

texts.en: Carlyn is 22 years of age, married, and has one child. She sells a variety of frozen foods, and has been in this type of business for three years now. Her main goal is to increase the amount of frozen foods she offers, but does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She knows that with this loan she could improve her financial stability and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ayeseh

texts.en:
Ayeseh is 44 years old and married, with eight family members, from Al Khalediah Al Mafraq Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 600 to pay for home improvements.  She wants to repaint her home and do other maintenance. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to increase the number of the rooms.  Also she would like in the future to open a project to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Jaleelah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Jaleelah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Jaleelah is a 31-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Jordan. She has 5 children. Jaleelah has requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for home improvement and painting expenses. She is also planning to buy curtains and carpets. in the future, Jaleelah plans to do further improvements to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 25-year-old single man from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 2000 JOD to improve his restaurant. He has a shawarma restaurant, but he would like to improve and develop his restaurant by expanding it. He hopes in the future to increase his customer base and buy a new home and car. 

Since Laith is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve his restaurant.

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en: Radwan is a 56-year-old married man from Bani Kenanah, Jordan. He has 6 children. Radwan has requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for opening a grocery store selling cleaning supplies, grocery items, and candies. in the future, Radwan plans to expand his project, adding shelves to the store, painting it and expanding the variety of items offered, in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for opening a small grocery store

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 34 years old and married, from Marka in Jordan. She has seven children.

She has requested a JOD 600 loan to pay for her making some improvements to her kitchen floor. in the future, Raeda is planning to do further improvements, buy some furnature, and buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Sultanah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Sultanah is a 33-year-old married woman  from Jarsah, Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for the home improvements that she would like to do, including maintaining her kitchen and buying new kitchen cabinets. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-years-old married man who has 5 family members and is from Sahab, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to repaint his home and to do maintenance to the home. He hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Mayada prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Mayada is 28 years old and married, from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She has two children.

She requested a JOD 500 loan to pay home improvement expenses and for buying some furnature for the living room. in the future, Mayada is planning to do further improvements and a project for her family to increase income.

loans.use: to pay home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Ayedah

texts.en: Ayedah is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan, who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture and to do home maintenance. Ayedah hopes, in the future, to buy more furniture and to do maintenance in the kitchen to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Zubaidah

texts.en: Zubaidah is 41 years old and a widow, from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of JD 600 to pay for home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to repaint her home and to do maintenance of the home to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Ebtisam prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son.

Ebtisam is 37 years old and married, from Irbid in Jordan.  She has four children.

She requested a JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buying some houseware. In the future, Ebtisam is planning to make further improvements and buy a new computer.

loans.use: to pay her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Zainab prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Zainab is 47 years old and married, from Al Russeifeh in Jordan.  She has five children.

She requested a JOD 500  loan to pay for home improvements and painting expenses before winter begins. in the future, Zainab is planning to make further improvements to her home, so her family's overall living conditions are enhanced.

loans.use: to pay her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Izdehar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet.  Therefore, the above photo is of her husband. Izdehar is a 46 year-old married woman who has five family members and she lives in Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to develop her home, buy new electronic appliances and to repaint.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Eman prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Therefore, the above photo is of her husband.

Eman is a 36 year-old married woman from Sahab in Jordan. She has three children and has requested a 600 JOD loan in order to pay for her home improvement expenses.  She plans to buy some furniture and housewares. In the future, Eman is planning to do further improvements including painting the whole house in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Rot

texts.en:
Rot is from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia.  She is a 44-year-old widowed mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and help the family’s business. 

For seven years, cassava planting and rice farming have been the main sources of income for her family. To earn additional income, Rot also buys and sells cassava in the local area. From the current business, she can earn about 83,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after the daily expenses. 

This is Rot's seventh loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She fully paid back the past loans which have helped her obtain enough food for the family's needs.  Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund in the amount of US$1,250. With this loan, she is going to buy a decent motor for commuting for her family and transporting her cassava and rice from the field. Rot hopes to be able to deliver her products to customers in a timely fashion in order to earn a larger income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor for commuting for her family.

loans.name: Ont

texts.en:
Ont, 52, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is married with four children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. The family’s main source of income is from rice farming on their eight-hectare farmland. His wife also supplements the income by selling grocery items. They have been in this business for twenty-five years.

This is the first microloan for Ont with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is now requesting a loan of US $700. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor to plow the field. He hopes to make more rice so as to sell it for a good price, and to make a better living and keep his child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Sert

texts.en:
Sert, 59, is married and lives with her husband and six children in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers who grow rice on 3 hectares of farmland. They have been in the rice farming business for thirty years. The main challenge for her family’s business is lack of working capital to buy fertilizer to better grow her crops. 

Sert is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan of US $700 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. With this loan, Sert hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and gasoline for water pumping

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 years, Chanthou is a mother of two children living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. To support her family, Chanthou and her husband have been farming rice and planting cucumber for almost ten years in the village. To gain more income, she also sells grocery items in her local area. 

Chanthou’s group consists of two members and she is the leader of this group. She and her group member are fifth-cycle clients. They fully repaid the past loans. Chanthou has wisely used the loans to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Chanthou will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her plantation, and she will use a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make her living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her plantation

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khitam is a 50-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who has seven family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance and repaint her home.  She also wants to buy new furniture.  She hopes in the future to buy new electronic appliances to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is a 54 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for home improvements. She wants to do maintenance of the home and to repaint her home.She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to improve her family living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en: Fatimah is a 53 year old married female from Hay Nazal in Jordan. She has 2 children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for clothes to retail. in the future, Fatimah is planning to widen the variety of the collection she offers, and open a shop with her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta is a 27-year-old mother of two children, aged eight and four years old. They all live in the northern Albania. Her husband has been working in the neighborhood country, in Greece for all these past years; thus, she has been managing to raise the children all on her own and run her business as well.

Antoneta owns an olive plantation and has had for the past five years. She started very small in the beginning with a few plants and she kept adding more to the number. She is at the point where she is happy with the progress and the benefit as well. 

Antoneta is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to build a fence around the olive plantation in order to protect it against damage from animals or bystanders too.

loans.use: To build a fence around the olive plantation to protect it against damage

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile, who lives in the northern Albania with her family, is in her mid fifties and is mother of six children. She was widowed long ago and was left to bring up the children on her own. 

She started a livestock activity about 20 years ago and has been operating it since then. While the first years were very difficult, it became easier later on, she explains. She has been working very hard at this business and has made a good profit that she is content about it.

She is now requesting a loan from VFA to replace a recent stolen milk cow. Dile has been a very good client of VFA for long time and has had the chance to show her responsible nature. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her financially and she wants to deliver her appreciation to them.

loans.use: To replace a recently stolen milk cow

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana, a 39-year-old married mother of four, lives in the suburbs of a little town in the North West Albania. The age of her children ranges from 3 to 14 years old. This is her first time requesting a loan. She wants to build a stable for the pigs with this loan.

In addition to her livestock activity that she has been practicing these past five years, she’s been making traditional embroideries for sale as well. She sells them in the market and gift stores in the capital city.

Marjana is the only financial provider for her family and proudly express that. She hopes that lenders at Kiva will provide her the financial help she’s requested to build the stable.

loans.use: To build a stable for pigs

loans.name: Pllumb

texts.en:
Pllumb is 30 years old and recently married. He was born with autism and due to his disability he was never given the opportunity to go to school. All these past years though he has been doing odd jobs until recently when he decided to run something on his own since he has heard from others that this activity is profitable. He wants to buy milk cows and sells their products. 

To establish this sort of activity, Pllumb needs 90,000 Albanian Lek and is applying for this amount through VisionFund Albania and Kiva. He remains positive that lenders will show some understanding and lend to him and his promise to them is that he will pay it back on time.

loans.use: To buy milk cows

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is 48 years old and was born with a disability. Despite this fact, she has managed to operate a business of her own and employ other women. She is married and has two children, twenty and two years old. They live in the northwest part of Albania and for the past six years she has been operating a green housing business that has proven to be profitable and specifically the last couple of years.
Rozina’s focus has been on planting veggie seeds and selling seedlings to locals. Since there are not many people in this activity, this works to her advantage.
Rozina is requesting a loan now to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fees for the public university that she was recently admitted to. She will be starting school in January.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en:
Shefqet is 42 years old and married. He has three children ranging in age from 10 to 16 years old, with the oldest one being treated in Greece for the past two years. He has been operating a construction business for the past eleven years and this activity keeps Shefqet busy because there is plenty of demand in this field in the northern region where he resides. 
The tools and equipment that he has been using in this business so far have been primitive and to speed up the process and avoid injuries and particularly during the winter time; he plans of buying proper and new tools. This is the reason why he is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase them and hopes that lenders will help him financially.

loans.use: To replace old construction tools with new ones in order to speed up the construction process and avoid injuries.

loans.name: Haidie Suigeins

texts.es:
Haidie es madre de 2 hijas, a quienes quiere mucho y sobre todo por quienes lucha cada día para darles una vida digna y sobre todo enseñarles que con mucho esfuerzo se pueden lograr muchas cosas. Ella vive en la sciudad de imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y en época de verano hay muchos turistas, ya que visitan sus playas hermosas. Haidie ha pasado por muchos problemas pero con valentía ha podido salir adelante sobre todo por sus hijas. Día a día Haidie trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas y gelatinas  desde hace 2 años, ella ofrece sus productos a sus vecinos de su barrio, ella le dedica alrededor de 8 horas al día y ella cree que  le va bien en su negocio por su amabilidad y sobre todo por la sazón que tiene para la preparación de sus platillos.

Haidie esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora y también podrá comprar bandejas nuevas, fuentes, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener los materiales necesario para seguir trabajando y poder luchar por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijas y tener una gran panadería”.
texts.en:
Haidie is mother to two daughters whom she loves very much and for whom she strives each day to provide a dignified life and to teach them that they can achieve goals with hard work. She lives in the city of Imperial, which is known for its pleasant climate and agriculture. Many tourists visit the beautiful beaches in the summer. 

Though Haidie has had numerous problems, she has courageously overcome them for her daughters. Every day for the past two years, she has sold sandwiches and jellos to her neighbors from her tiny business. She works eight hours a day and believes her friendly nature and the great taste of her food have made her successful. Haidie thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will let her buy a refrigerator and new trays, molds, and other items. She will have the supplies she needs to keep working and to make her greatest dreams come true: giving her daughters a good education and owning a large bakery.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Evaristo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Evaristo de 48 años de edad, es casado su esposa trabaja como docente en una escuela, tienen 2 hijas que dependen de ellos que estudian la primaria y secundaria, el trabaja como conductor para una empresa privada desde hace 9 años con esos ingresos de salarios muy bajos han logrado salir adelante cubriendo los diferentes gastos básicos del hogar. Solicita este crédito  para destinarlos a mejoras de vivienda, para construcción de paredes divisorias para cuartos y de tapia, lo que ayudara a su  familia brindándole mayor privacidad, comodidad y también seguridad ya que en el área de su patio solo cuentan con un cerco que no es seguro, para comenzar esta obra requiere comprar materiales como cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagara la mano de obra.
texts.en: Señor Evaristo is 48 years old. He is married, and his wife works as a teacher in a school. They have two daughters who depend on them who are in primary and secondary school. He has worked as a driver for a private business for 9 years. With these incomes from very low salaries, they have managed to advance, covering the various basic expenses of the household. He is applying for this loan to direct it toward improvements in their home, to construct walls to divide the rooms and a wall to surround their house, which will help his family by offering them better privacy, comfort, and also security, since in the area of their patio they have only a fence, which is not secure. To begin this work, he needs to buy materials such as cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel and pay for labor

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es: Doña  Gioconda de 42 años de edad, es soltera tiene una hija que depende de ella y que estudia la primaria, trabaja desde hace 9 años para una institución del estado como inspectora. Solicita este octavo crédito para terminar de comprar materiales para invertirlos en la construcción de su casa, con el préstamo anterior logro comprar una parte y levanto 4 paredes, pero aun le faltan las puertas, el zinc y perlines para ponerle el techo y desea hacer un porche en la parte delantera de la casa para que su pequeña juegue. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que sola ha sacado adelante a su hija y gracias a los financiamientos ha podido ir cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de tener su propia casa con las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en: Gioconda is 42 years old, single, and has a daughter in elementary school.  She has worked for nine years for a state institution as an inspector.  She is requesting her eighth loan to finish purchasing materials for the construction of her house.  With the previous loan she was able to purchase part of the materials and raise four walls.  She is still missing doors, zinc sheeting, and beams to put up the roof.  She would also like to put a porch in the back part of the house so that her daughter can play there.  She is a hardworking woman who has improved her daughter's life alone.  Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to slowly accomplish her dream of having her own home with the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beams, doors, zinc sheeting, materials for windows, cement, stone blocks, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jassel Raquel

texts.es: La joven Jassel de 22 años de edad, es soltera, estudia la carrera de ingeniería industrial, está en el quinto año de su carrera y solicita este segundo crédito para realizar la compra de libros y enciclopedias necesarias para reforzar sus estudios y también para cubrir el pago del curso de titulación. Su padre le apoya económicamente con los pagos del préstamo, la joven además de estudiar se dedica al comercio de chinelas, artículos personales y del hogar para apoyarse con sus gastos, con el financiamiento anterior pudo adquirir su propia computadora que le facilito sus estudios ya que le permitió contar con su propia herramienta para realizar sus trabajos e investigaciones.
texts.en:
Jassel is a single, 22-year-old woman who is in the fifth year of her Industrial Engineering studies. 

This is the second loan she has requested, which will go towards the purchase of books and encyclopedias that are necessary to strengthen her studies.  The loan will also cover the cost of her degree certification.  Her father supports her financially with the loan payments.  

In addition to studying, she sells flip-flops, personal products, and home products to help cover her expenses.  She was able to acquire her own computer with the last loan. This has made studying easier by allowing her to have her own tool with which to complete her assignments and do research.

loans.use: to buy books and pay for her degree certification.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 3 años en casa de sus Padres en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos familiares, no pudo estudiar la carrera de Educación que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al dinero que pudo ahorrar cuando trabaja en una panadería, Elvis pudo comprarse su propia mototaxi, la cual maneja y brinda servicios de transporte, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y porque trata bien a sus clientes.
Elvis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su mototaxi; de esta manera Elvis tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder generar mayores ingresos económicos, con ello Elvis espera poco a poco ir asegurando en bienestar y la educación de su pequeño y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elvis is 24 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old son at his parent's home in Cañete, which is in the district of Imperial. He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiatic person. Elvis and his wife put all their efforts into providing for their family. Unfortunately, a lack of financial resources and the need to work to cover the household expenses meant he could not study for an Education degree as he would have wished and would have liked to have done. 

Thanks to his committment, effort and the money he saved while working at a bakery, Elvis was able to buy his own motor-rickshaw which he drives and uses to provide a transport service. Everyday from early in the morning he drives through the city's streets searching for passengers. He believes he does well because he is responsible and because he treats his clients well. 

Elvis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to carry out much-needed repairs and general maintenance for his motor-rickshaw. His tool of the trade will then be in better condition and this will help him increase his income. Elvis hopes to, bit by bit, ensure his young son's well-being and education, and perhaps, in the near future he will be able to achieve his greatest dream: to have his own house.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and general maintenance for his motor-rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: La sra. Rosibel de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene a su cargo 2 hijos que dependen de ella, uno estudia la secundaria y otro menor de 3 años quien todavía no va a clases, ella es una clienta muy trabajadora que ha sacado a sus hijos adelante con esfuerzo y trabajo como docente en una escuela privada desde hace 12 años, un empleo con un salario muy bajo pero así se las ingenia Rosibel para darle el pan de cada día a sus hijos. Solicita su onceavo crédito para continuar haciéndole mejoras a su casa, esta vez hará un cuarto que le servirá para brindar mayor comodidad y espacio a su familia porque actualmente todos duermen en la misma habitación y no tienen privacidad, por lo que necesitara comprar  cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques, hierro y el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en: Rosibel, who is 40 years old, is single, has 2 children that depend on her. One is in high school and the other is under 3 years old and doesn't go to school yet. She is a very hardworking client that has taken her children forward with strength as a teacher in a private school for the last 12 years. This is a job with a very low salary, but Rosibel does manage to give bread every day to her children. She is requesting her 11th credit to continue making improvements to her home. This time she will make a room that will serve to provide better comfort and space to her family because today they all sleep in the same room and do not have privacy. For this she will need cement, sand, gravel, blocks, iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, blocks, iron and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Josue Rolando

texts.es:
Josue es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica al lado de sus padres, es un joven muy alegre al cual le gusta escuchar música en sus pocos tiempos libres ya que el trabaja en una empresa como repartidor de productos, el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera encantado poder estudiar ingeniería de sistemas, pero debido a sus pocos recursos económicos no lo pudo lograr. Josue trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y cree que le va bien e su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Josue está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una refrigeradora ya que actualmente no tiene donde almacenar sus alimentos, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Josue is 20 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, next to his parents. He is a very happy young man who likes to listen to music in what little free time he has, as he works delivering products for a company.

He was only able to study up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have loved to study systems engineering. Due to his limited financial resources, he was not able to achieve this. Josue works about eight hours per day. He thinks that the job is going well, because he is very responsible and above all he has the willpower to move forward.

Josue is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy a refrigerator. Currently, he has nowhere to store his food. In this way, he can improve his quality of life and continue fighting to make his dream come true: "To have my own house."

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es: El sr. José Emilio de 35 años de edad, es acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa sus 3 hijos siempre están estudiando gracias a su trabajo desde hace 3 años para una institución del estado como ayudante de albañilería, toda su familia depende de su salario ya que él es el único que trabaja. Solicita este tercer crédito para continuar con la construcción de su vivienda que actualmente tiene partes forradas de laminas de zinc lo cual produce mucho calor durante el día, lo primero que hará es la construcción de paredes de concreto, por lo que necesitara comprar cemento, arena, hierro, piedrines, bloques y pagara la mano de obra para poder brindar a su familia un lugar seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
José Emilio is 35 years old. His wife is a housewife, and his three children are always studying, thanks to his job for the past 3 years working as a bricklayer's assistant for a state institution. His entire family depends on his salary, as he is the only person in the family who works. 

He is asking for this third loan to continue building his house. Currently, some parts of the house are covered with zinc panels, which produce a lot of heat during the day. The first thing José Emilio will do is build concrete walls, for which he needs to buy cement, sand, iron, gravel, and blocks. He will also pay for labor costs, all in order to give his family a safe place to live.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, gravel, blocks, and to pay for labor expenses to build a house.

loans.name: Solidario Solidarista Group

texts.es: Solidario Solidarista, este grupo está formado por la señora Manuela de 36 años de edad madre de 2 niñas ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos comestibles como, queso crema, requesón etc., tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad el propósito de ella es agrandar más su negocio y darles lo necesario a sus hijos paraqué tengan un mejor futuro, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más productos comestibles( queso crema, requesón etc.,)espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito ya que es la segunda vez que solicita de la ayuda de kiva en el primer crédito pago puntual y no callo en mora.
texts.en:
Solidario Solidarista includes Manuela, a 36-year-old mother of two daughters. She sells different food products like cream cheese, cottage cheese, etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Her intention is to make her business larger and give what is necessary to her children so that they may have a better future. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more food products (cream cheese, cottage cheese, etc.). She hopes that you can help her with this loan since it is the second time that she has requested Kiva's assistance. In the first loan, she paid punctually and did not default.

loans.use: to buy more food products (cream cheese, cottage cheese, etc.)

loans.name: Dúo Kayros Group

texts.es:
DÚO KAYROS
La señora Rosa Julieta es integrante del Dúo kayros actualmente ella se encuentra negociando con su negocio de zapatos y venta de ropa en diferentes diseños el cual ha podido incrementar atraves de los créditos que fape le ha otorgado es madre de 3 hijos y tiene varios sueños y metas grandes para su familia por lo que ella en esta oportunidad toca las puertas de fape para adquirir un Nuevo crédito ya que el sueño y el anhelo de ella es de poder surtir otro local de zapato y sandalia y tambien de ropa por lo que espera en Dios que ustedes pueda ayudarla con dicha solicitud.
texts.en:
Rosa Julieta is a member of Dúo Kayros. Currently she is dealing with her shoe and clothing business which has been able to expand through loans that FAPE has given her. She is a mother of three children and has several big dreams and goals for her family. 

She is taking this opportunity to knock on the FAPE doors for a new loan since her dream and desire is to be able to have another local shoe, sandal, and clothing store. She has hope in God you can help her with this request.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for sale.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis tiene 32 años, vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años . su vivienda se ubica en la cálida ciudad de Pisco. Luis enrique es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque debe sacar adelante a su familia ya que los ama mucho y hace hasta lo imposible por darles una vida digna y sobre todo con honradez. Luis trabaja como tractorista (maneja tractores), el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia, pero en algunas ocasiones puede demorar un poco mas ya que mayormente lo contratan para el arado de tierras de cultivo, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Luis eta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena, hormigón, entre otros para el mejoramiento de las paredes de la vivienda donde habita de esta manera el podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio muy grande y darle uan buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children, who are fifteen and eight. Their home is located in the warm city of Pisco. Luis Enrique is a very hard worker, primarily because he must provide for his family, whom he loves very much. With honesty above all, he goes above and beyond to give them a decent life. Luis works as a tractor driver for around ten hours a day, but sometimes it can take longer because he is mostly hired to plow farm land. He thinks business is going well for him because he is responsible and kind to his customers.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the help they provide will allow him to purchase materials like cement, sand, concrete, etc. in order to improve the walls of the home where he lives. This way he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream come true: to have a very large business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeña hija de 2 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacara adelante a su pequeña, ya que desde que nació, es madre y padres para ella; lamentablemente Janet no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeña y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace mas de dos años Janet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de juguetes y siliconas para autos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella realiza sus ventas en la plaza de armas de su ciudad y puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por la variedad de juguetes que ofrece y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Janet se siente muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como juguetes para niños de todas las edades y siliconas para autos; de esta manera Janet tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder para que poco a poco pueda tener su casa propia y así desea brindarle una mejora calidad de vida a su pequeña.
texts.en:
Janet is 20 years old. She lives in the city of Chincha with her 2-year-old daughter. whom she loves and who is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to provide for her little one. Since she was born, Janet has been both mother and father to her. 

Unfortunately, Janet was not able to study a professional career, although she would have liked to, because she had to work to support her parents from a young age. In her free time, she likes to play with her daughter, and sometimes she cooks a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a traditional stew from her region) to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with plenty of effort and determination, Janet started her small business selling toys and silicone spray for cars two years ago. Every day, she starts working in the early morning, selling merchandise in the Plaza de Armas in her city. She works for about 8 hours per day. She thinks the business is going well, because of the variety of toys which she offers and the friendly care which she gives her customers.

Janet is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, such as children's toys and silicone spray. In this way, she will be able to better stock her business, and she hopes to increase her sales and profits. This will be a great help so that, little by little, she can have her own house and provide her daughter with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Angela Concepción

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda pero de esa relación  tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijas están solteras aun viven con ella.

Doña Angela hace varios estudió repostería y pastelería en una Universidad de Manabí donde obtuvo su título y hoy tiene un local donde ella elabora y vende los más deliciosos bocadillos y pasteles de toda la zona, ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace porque todo lo hace lo realiza con amor, prepara bufet para fiestas y para cualquier compromiso social, también los fines de semana preparan y vende comida. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y los fines de semana todo el día, a veces le ayudan sus dos hijas cuando llegan de sus estudios. Lleva mas de 12 años con su negocio con lo cual se gana su sustento y  le encanta su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  materiales como harina, azúcar, huevos, leche, manteca, etc. para la elaboración de los bocadillos. Está en el banco comunal hace más de 11 años y le gusta porque siempre están atentos a las necesidades de los socios.

Su meta es tener un negocio más industrializado para llevar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
In the parrish of Quiroga in the city of Calceta, a town where the people make a living largely through agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products, the Quiroga Communal Bank gets together every 15 days.

This is where Señora Ángela lives.  She is 62 years old, and has been a widow for several years but from the relationship has seven children; all of whom are older, though two of her daughters who are single still live with her.  For several years, Doña Angela studied confectionery and baking in the University of Manabí where she got her degree, and today she has a shop where she makes and sells the most delicious sandwiches and cakes in the entire area.  She is very proud of what she does because everything that she does, she does with love.  She prepares buffets for parties and for any social engagement, and on the weekends she also makes and sells food.  She works every day in the afternoons and on weekends she works all day; sometimes her two daughters help her when they return from their studies.  She has spent more than 12 years with her business through which she earns a livelihood, and she loves her business.  

She will use this loan to buy materials like flour, sugar, eggs, milk, lard, etc. for making sandwiches.  She has been with the communal bank for more than 11 years and likes it because it is always attentive to the needs of its members.  Her goal is to have a more industrialized business in order to take her products to other cities.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, milk, lard, etc.

loans.name: Edhita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Edhita Del Carmen, tiene 44 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijas, tres de las cuales ya son independientes y solo una de sus hijas vive con ella.
 
Doña Edita Del Casrmen hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y como sabe de costura y tiene un pequeño taller en el cual realiza varios tipos de trabajos, ella cose de todo desde ropa de damas hasta ropa de niños pero lo que más le gusta confeccionar es ropa de damas. También se dedica a la cría de animales de corral ya que esto no le quita mayor tiempo y con lo cual se gana algo extra que le sirve de mucho para los gastos del hogar ya que ella es sola y tiene que ver como le saca adelante a su hija que aun vive con ella.  Lleva más de 15 años dedicada a la costura y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales de costura. Lleva siete años en el Banco Comunal y s le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su meta es tener su casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a location where most residents work in agriculture, animal husbandry and selling their products.  Edhita Del Carmen, 44, lives here.  She’s separated but has four daughters; three of them are already independent and only one of her daughters still lives with her.

Several years ago, Edhita Del Carmen learned dressmaking and design at a local academy and since she knows how to sew and has a small workshop where she does all types of jobs, she sews all types of women’s clothes and even children’s clothes but what she likes best is to make women’s clothes.  She also raises small farm animals because this doesn’t require much time and she’s able to earn a little extra that’s very useful for covering household expenses since she’s alone and has to find the way to move her daughter who still lives with her ahead.  She’s been working making clothes for more than 15 years and thanks to this has been able to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread and other sewing supplies.  She’s been in the communal bank for seven years and likes it because of the ease in getting loans.  Her goal is to make her house out of cement since it’s currently made of sugarcane stalks.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Freddy De La Cruz

texts.es: El sr. Freddy de 37 años de edad, es casado su esposa es ama de casa tienen dos hijos uno en primaria y otro no está en edad escolar. El continua trabajando como ayudante de albañil desde hace 3 años para el estado, su familia depende de su salario ya que es el único que trabaja. Solicita un tercer crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques, hierro para poner el piso de su casa, ya que es de tierra y es muy peligroso para los niños por el polvo y con las lluvias el lodo que se produce, cabe mencionar que don freddy ha construido su casa poco a poco con financiamientos, para poder cubrir estos gastos y así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Freddy, 37, is married; his wife’s a housewife and they have two children, one attending primary school and the other still too young to attend school.  He continues working for the state as a construction assistant; he’s been working for three years.  His family depends on his salary since he’s the only one employed.  He’s asking for his third loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand, blocks and rebar to install a floor at home since it’s dirt and very dangerous for the children because of the dust and mud produced in the rainy season.  It’s worth mentioning that Freddy has been building his house gradually with help from loans that make it possible for him to cover these expenses to provide better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and rebar to install a floor at home.

loans.name: Reina De La Nube  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Reina de la Nube es un banco comunal que está conformado por 6 socias y 1 socio,  son amigas y en su mayoria se dedican a laborar como degustadoras, sus trabajos le permiten aportar a la económica de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias, son mujeres amables, gentiles y muy alegres a pesar de las adversidades. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene un clima frió, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, gracias a su geografía accidentada tiene varios lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente tiene un gran carisma y un corazón muy cálido,  su cultura y tradiciones enamora a quienes la visitan.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. María Fernanda, está realizando el primer crédito en conjunto con sus amigas en el banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es de profesión chofer y su mamá es comerciante, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

Ella está trabajando por el momento realizando publicidad de campañas políticas, pero la mayor parte  de su tiempo se dedica a sus estudios Universitarios, ya que se encuentra en el primer ciclo de la carrera de Ingeniería en Contabilidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir ven el pago de la matricula y en la compra de libros para seguir con sus estudios universitarios.

Su meta es llegar a graduarse y ser una buena profesional. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Reina de la Nube is a communal bank with seven members - six female and one male. They are friends and most of them work handing out product samples. Their work allows them to contribute to household expenses and help their families keep going. They are kind and pleasant, and very cheerful despite the adversities they face. They live in different areas of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate which has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999. Thanks to its rugged geography Cuenca has many sites to visit and enjoy nature. Its people are very charismatic and warm-hearted, and visitors to Cuenca fall in love with its culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is María Fernanda. She is requesting her first loan together with her friends from Reina de la Nube communal bank. She lives in the Monay area of the city of Cuenca. She is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father is a driver and her mother runs a business. The house María Fernanda lives in is owned by her parents.

At the moment she is working on advertising for political campaigns, but most of her time is devoted to her university studies, as she is in her first year of an accountancy degree. She will invest the money in fees and books for her course so that she can continue with her university studies. Her goal is to graduate and be a good professional worker. 

The smaller photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to pay course fees and buy books

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
Raúl es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Computación e Informática que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones su mamá cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Raúl trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Raúl se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Raúl cuenta con una pequeña habitación, la cual le han cedido para que él pueda vivir en ella, así pues Raúl desea poder poner el piso de concreto que necesita, para tener mayor seguridad y bienestar; de esta manera Raúl seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Raúl, 20, is a single man living in the city of Ica in Santiago District with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working when he was still very young to help out his parents, he’s been unable to study Computer Programming like he wanted to but would still like to do so very much.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and on some occasions his mother cooks a delicious “Arroz con Mariscos” (Rice with Seafood) to pamper him since this is his favorite dish.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Raúl works as a field worker at a large agricultural estate in his city.  He heads out to work every day very early in the morning and can work approximately ten hours.  He believes he does well because of the good way he does his job and the kind way he treats others.

Raúl is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to do some home improvements because thanks to his parents’ support Raúl has a small bedroom they’ve given him so that he can live in it.  Raúl wants to install the concrete floor it needs to have more security and wellbeing and Raúl will continue working and striving so that together with his family he’ll be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Trancito Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora Trancito se encuentra en el séptimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de Chiquintad en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, también se puede disfrutar de su cultura, sus tradiciones y su gastronomía.

Doña Trancito tiene 38 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 20, 18, 14, 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos siguientes hijas trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarta hija está en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su casa es propia siendo la recompensa de su trabajo.

La Señora. Trancito se dedica hace algunos años en la crianza de pollos que los vende pelados, también trabaja como empleada domestica actividad que la realiza solo medio día y de lunes a sábados.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar la crianza de estos animales. 
Su meta es salir en adelante conjuntamente con sus hijos y darle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Trancito is requesting her seventh loan throught the communal bank Loma de la Cruz. She lives in the Chiquintad area in the city of Cuenca, where the weather is cold but the people are very warmhearted. There are several places there where you can enjoy nature. You can also enjoy the culture, traditions, and cuisine.

Trancito is 38 years old. She is a widow and has seven children from her marriage, who are ages twenty, eighteen, fourteen, twelve, ten, eight, and six. Her oldest daughter is married and lives on her own, the next two work and help her out financially, her fourth is in school, and her three youngest go to a little local school. She owns their house, a reward she has earned by working.

Trancito has been working raising chickens for several years. She sells them plucked, and also works as a domestic, but that is a part time job she has from Monday through Saturday half a day. 
 
He is going to invest her new loan in purchasing chickens so that she can raise more of these animals. Her goal is to get ahead so that her children have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Karina Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora Karina es una socia que conforma hace algún tiempo el banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, también se puede disfrutar de su cultura, sus tradiciones y su  gastronomía.
 
La Señora. Karina es muy joven tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha para tener estabilidad económica, hace 4 años trabaja como comerciante ambulante de ropa y hace 6 meses está trabajando como empleada privada, estas dos actividades le dan más solvencia económica y puede salir en adelante con su familia.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando ropa y su nuevo crédito al igual que el anterior lo va a invertir en ropa para vender a su exigente y selecta clientela, la cancelación de su crédito anterior lo realizo en las fechas correspondiente. La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos le dan la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina has been a member of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank for some time. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. 

Cuenca is characterized by a cold climate, but its people have warm hearts. There are various places to enjoy nature, and one can also enjoy the culture, traditions, and gastronomy of the region.

Karina is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and has a 2-year-old child. Her spouse is a merchant. They don't have their own house, so they are renting.

She is a very enterprising woman who fights for financial stability. For four years, she has made a living as a traveling clothes saleswoman. For the past six months, she has also been working as a private employee. These two activities give her more financial solvency and ensure that she and her family will be better off.

She used her previous loan to buy clothing, and she will use the new loan in the same way, investing in clothing to sell to her demanding and select clientele. She paid off her previous loan on the appropriate dates. She likes being a member of her communal bank because the loans give her the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Dalila hace algunos años forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, también se puede disfrutar de su cultura, sus tradiciones y su gastronomía.

La Señora Dalila tiene 59 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y ahora labora como comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Dalila se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros productos, esta actividad la desempeña hace algunos años, este trabajo le ha permitido mejorar su economía y sacar adelante a toda su familia.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando ropa, sabanas, edredones, etc. ya que tenia algunos pedidos, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en ropa para la época navideña que se acerca, en la cancelación de su crédito anterior no tuvo dificultad por lo que realizo los pagos en las fechas correspondientes. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo del grupo y las charlas de educación que reciben en cada reunión.
texts.en:
Dalila has been part of the communal bank Loma de la Cruz for several years. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys a cold climate, but its people have very warm hearts. It has various places to enjoy nature. One can also enjoy its culture, its traditions and its gourmet cooking.

Dalila is 59 years old, is married and in her married union conceived 4 children. Three of them are married and live independently. Her single child works and helps her financially. Her husband is retired and now works as a shopkeeper. She doesn't have her own home because she rents.

Dalila sells clothing and other items. This work got her out of debt several years ago. This work allowed her to improve her finances and come out ahead with her whole family.

She invested her previous loan in buying clothing, sheets, comforters, etc. since she already had several orders. Now she is going to invest her new loan in clothing for the Christmas period that is approaching. She had no difficulties in the settlement of her previous loan because she made the payments on the corresponding dates. She likes the communal bank because of the comradeship of the group and the educational talks that they receive at each meeting.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: San

texts.en: A villager residing in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia, San is a 44-year-old married woman with four children, some of whom are dependent on her and currently in school while the other some are have their own employment. To offer decent life for her family, San works as a rice farmer on a four-hectare plot of farmland. San’s husband raises four heads of pig in order to add more income to the family. San is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a USD 1,250 loan. This industrious woman will use some portion of her requested loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the wages of farm laborers. The other portion of the loan will be spent on buying more plots of farmland so that she can expand her business as well as increase the income. San believes that via the help of this loan her business will provide with a good-quality crop so that she can sell in a good price generating even more income to the family. Thus, she will be able to use the anticipated income to keep her school-aged children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the wages of farm laborers

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: A citizen residing in a rural area of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Mon is 58 years old and married. She has four children, of whom one son is under her responsibility. Mon makes her living through farming rice and planting cassava, the business in which she has been involved for more than 25 years, enabling her to earn around 50,000KHR and save approximately 25,000KHR after canceling out her daily cost of living. Mon, a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member named Meoun, a second-cycle client with VisionFund, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200,000KHR each. Mon is so satisfied with the previous loans that she had successfully paid back because she has been able to secure food needs for her beloved family. Now with her new requested loan portion, Mon plans on buying fertilizer, pesticide, and seeds (rice seeds and cassava seeds). In the future, she hopes that her business will result in good quality and higher crop yields so that she can sell them for greater profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and seeds (rice seeds and cassava seeds)

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Chorn is 45 years of age and married. Her family resides in a rural village of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Chorn has six children, five (two daughters and three sons) of whom are students and dependent on her. To earn finances for the family, she has a business planting cassava and cashews, earning around 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) and saving approximately 20,000 KHR for future needs after offsetting her daily expenses. 

Chorn is leading a loan group of two women, both of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. This group representative, Chorn, will utilize her loan portion in this loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to apply to her farmland in hopes of keeping it in good shape. Chorn hopes to be able to earn more income, improve the living conditions of her family, and most importantly, be able to advance her children’s education further.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun, a villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia, is a 41-year-old married woman with four dependent children, all of whom are school-aged children. To support her family, Saveoun has been farming rice and planting cassava for more than ten years. 

She has been a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing her family’s finances and food needs for the family. Saveoun's loan group consists of three female members who are applying for the loan in the amount of 3,100,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) in total. This hard-working group leader, Saveoun, plans on utilizing her loan portion to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds (rice seeds and cassava seeds) to help smoothly support her farmland, which generates the resources needed in her family. 

Saveoun would be very happy to be able to see the improvement in her current business as well as the living standards of her family. She will be even happier to be able to advance her children’s education further.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds (rice seeds and cassava seeds).

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ratanak Mondol district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Savon, 50, is a married mother of five children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. The source of her family’s income is from farming on a one-hectare area of farmland and raising pigs while her husband also earns additional income by buying and selling garbage in local area. She and her husband have been in this business for ten years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of working capital.

This is Savon's sixth loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She successfully repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden and support her children’s education. Now she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future. With the need to support her business, she is now leading her group of four to request another loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland, as well as use a portion of it for land plowing. With this loan, Savon hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kha's Group

texts.en:
Kha is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice on five hectares of farmland. They have been in this business for 27 years. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and are able to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Kha’s group consists of five members living in the same area. This is Kha's first loan with VisionFund. She is now leading this group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Ren is a 33-year-old mother of two children; all of whom are still dependent on her and in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on three-hectare of farmland and planting sesame on three-hectare of farmland as the main sources of the family’s income. They have been in this business for almost ten years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs. Insufficient working capital to buy fertilizers for applying to her cultivated land is the main challenge for her farming business.

Ren’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her co-member to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have more healthy crops and earn more income to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, 46, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has one child (daughter) to take care of and still in school. To feed the family, Kim and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for ten years and sometimes work as a paid worker to earn additional income for the family. They earn about 18,000 riels (KHR) per day to spend for the family’s needs. 
This is Kim’s group loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund and her group has only two members who just with VisionFund this loan cycle. She is now leading her group to apply for another loan. Kim is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Roth, aged 49, is married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Sangke district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice, raising pigs, and catching fish in her village. She has been running her business for 10 years, earning about KHR 30,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 10,000 every day.

Roth has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and has completely repaid her previous loans while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. The previous loans have helped Roth to better support her current business and to support her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy casting nets for her fishing business. Roth hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income thus making a better living and also keeping her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and casting nets for her fishing business

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Dy, 55, is single and lives in a village of the Ek Phnom district. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cabbage for thirty-three years. Her business currently earns her approximately 18,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. From that, she manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after offsetting her daily expenses. 

There are two members in Dy’s group and they are both first-cycle clients with VisionFund. Dy is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation, as well as labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, 46 years old, is married and lives in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is still in school. For almost ten years, Saron and her husband have earned a living through farming rice on 2 hectares of farmland and planting cassava on 3.5 hectares of farmland, earning approximately 40,000 KHR per day from the current business. She can save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Saron has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles while the other member has been for one cycle. She completely repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to request 2,000,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use the remainder to pay for labor costs. Saron hopes to make more crop yields and sell them for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Dambae district, Nan is a 36-year-old mother of six children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The family's main sources of income have been rice farming on 1 hectare of farmland and cassava planting on 1 hectare of farmland, for the past 18 years. Nan currently can earn about KHR (Cambodian riels) 20,000 daily from her business for daily expenses. Low crop yields resulting from floods is the main challenge for her farming business.

This is the first loan for Nan’s group of three female members. She is leading her group in applying for a loan. As the leader, Nan will use her portion to buy pesticides for protecting her farmland and use the remainder to pay for labor. Nan hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from the plantation so as to sell the harvest for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for protecting her farmland.

loans.name: Sek's Group

texts.en:
Sek, aged 55, is a widowed mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To feed her children, she has been engaged in planting cassava and cashews  on five hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 30 years, Sek is able to earn about 60,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 30,000 KHR of this for future needs.

Sek has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle, while the other members of her group have been with VisionFund for from one to two loan cycles. Sek successfully repaid her previous loan which helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden and improved her livelihood. Now, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sek is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her cultivated land. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her plantation so she can make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Seng, aged 43, is a villager residing in Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with six lovely children, five (three daughters and two sons) of whom are students and still dependent on her. To offer a decent life for her family, she grows rice on a one-hectare plot of farmland and plants cassava on a two-hectare plot of farmland. Having been in this business for 20 years, Seng is able to earn around 54,000 KHR and manages to save approximately 25,000 KHR of this for future needs. 

Seng has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already with which she accomplished securing her family's food needs and, most importantly, keeping her beloved children in school which makes her feel so satisfied. Seng is leading a group of two female members who are each applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR. 

The group leader, Seng, will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and seeds (rice and cassava) to support her farmland. She believes that her family’s livelihood as well as her family’s income will be gradually improved after receiving her loan portion and using it as she plans. She will also use the anticipated income to further advance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and seeds (rice and cassava)

loans.name: Leoung's Group

texts.en:
Leoung is 55 years old and lives in a rural area of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He is married, and the couple is blessed with three children. Leoung is a hard-working person. 

He has been working tirelessly in his current business growing cassava to continually provide income for his beloved family. Leoung’s wife is also an industrious woman. She helps earn more income for the family by running a small local store selling grocery items. 

To run his cassava-growng business smoothly, Leoung is leading a loan group of nine members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  They are seeking a loan of KHR 7,700,000 in total. As a group representative, Leoung will use his loan portion, which is KHR 1,000,000, to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor fees. 

Leoung believes that his first-ever requested loan will have a huge positive impact on his cassava-growng business as well as his family's living standard.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor fees

loans.name: Tine

texts.en:
Tine is a 52-year-old mother of three independent children who lives in northeast Albania. Her husband, who worked in a quarry for years, has been paralyzed for some time now; thus, Tine has been doing everything with respect to their home and their business. She has been doing agricultural activities for the past eighteen years. 

Tine owns an olive plantation and sells olives to make pickles and also produces olive oil. She now wants to build a fence around her plantation and to achieve this she needs a Kiva loan. She has requested a loan of 150,000 Albanian leks (ALL) and hopes that with lenders’ help she will be able to finish building the fence before harvesting time.  

Tine’s goals include expanding her business and building a new house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her olive plantation

loans.name: Lizana

texts.en:
Lizana is in her early forties and is married with two school-aged children. Her family immigrated to Greece fifteen years ago, yet recently came back to their native village due to the economic crises that the neighboring country has been going through the last few years. 

Upon their arrival, they opened a variety store and have been operating it since. The profit that she has been making has been satisfactory, according to her. She plans to expand the business in the future by reaching out to new clientele in order to earn enough income to educate her children.

Lizana is now requesting a Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania to stock up on inventory items.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items.

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
John, who is in his early 50s, is married and he lives with his wife with one elder child who goes to school. He has been a daladala (hiace bus) driver for  1 1/2 years now. He works from 5am to 9pm daily and he is able to earning a very good monthly profit.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy building equipment, daladala (hiace bus) spare parts, paid school fees and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He requested this loan to buy more daladala spare parts to resell. His  dream is to one day be able to own a three-wheels motorcycle also known as Bajaj.
